var uV = f.forwardRef((t, s) => {
    const {__scopeCollapsible: r, present: n, children: a, ...i} = t,
        o = P0(_0, r),
        [l, c] = f.useState(n),
        d = f.useRef(null),
        u = ot(s, d),
        m = f.useRef(0),
        p = m.current,
        y = f.useRef(0),
        g = y.current,
        x = o.open || l,
        b = f.useRef(x),
        j = f.useRef(void 0);
    return f.useEffect(() => {
        const h = requestAnimationFrame(() => b.current = !1);
        return () => cancelAnimationFrame(h)
    }, []), ys(() => {
        const h = d.current;
        if (h) {
            j.current = j.current || {
                transitionDuration: h.style.transitionDuration,
                animationName: h.style.animationName
            },
            h.style.transitionDuration = "0s",
            h.style.animationName = "none";
            const v = h.getBoundingClientRect();
            m.current = v.height,
            y.current = v.width,
            b.current || (h.style.transitionDuration = j.current.transitionDuration, h.style.animationName = j.current.animationName),
            c(n)
        }
    }, [o.open, n]), e.jsx(De.div, {
        "data-state": T0(o.open),
        "data-disabled": o.disabled ? "" : void 0,
        id: o.contentId,
        hidden: !x,

            p = be(t.onKeyDown, y => {
                var _;
                if (!pV.includes(y.key))
                    return;

                        return !((B = T.ref.current) != null && B.disabled)

                if (b === -1)
                    return;
                y.preventDefault();

                const v = 0,
                    N = j - 1,
                    w = () => {
                        h = b + 1,
                        h > N && (h = v)
                    },
                    C = () => {
                        h = b - 1,
                        h < v && (h = N)

                switch (y.key) {
                case "Home":
                    h = v;
                    break;
                case "End":
                    h = N;
                    break;
                case "ArrowRight":
                    i === "horizontal" && (m ? w() : C());
                    break;
                case "ArrowDown":
                    i === "vertical" && w();
                    break;
                case "ArrowLeft":
                    i === "horizontal" && (m ? C() : w());
                    break;
                case "ArrowUp":
                    i === "vertical" && C();
                    break

            scope: r,
            disabled: n,
            direction: a,

                scope: r,

                })

var ym = t => t.type === "checkbox",
    Do = t => t instanceof Date,
    gr = t => t == null;
const X_ = t => typeof t == "object";
var vs = t => !gr(t) && !Array.isArray(t) && X_(t) && !Do(t),
    J_ = t => vs(t) && t.target ? ym(t.target) ? t.target.checked : t.target.value : t,
    kV = t => t.substring(0, t.search(/\.\d+(\.|$)/)) || t,
    eT = (t, s) => t.has(kV(s)),
    PV = t => {
        const s = t.constructor && t.constructor.prototype;
        return vs(s) && s.hasOwnProperty("isPrototypeOf")
    },
    D0 = typeof window < "u" && typeof window.HTMLElement < "u" && typeof document < "u";
function Hs(t) {
    let s;
    const r = Array.isArray(t),
        n = typeof FileList < "u" ? t instanceof FileList : !1;
    if (t instanceof Date)
        s = new Date(t);
    else if (t instanceof Set)
        s = new Set(t);
    else if (!(D0 && (t instanceof Blob || n)) && (r || vs(t)))
        if (s = r ? [] : {}, !r && !PV(t))
            s = t;
        else
            for (const a in t)
                t.hasOwnProperty(a) && (s[a] = Hs(t[a]));
    else
        return t;
    return s
}
var Bp = t => Array.isArray(t) ? t.filter(Boolean) : [],
    ms = t => t === void 0,
    _e = (t, s, r) => {
        if (!s || !vs(t))
            return r;
        const n = Bp(s.split(/[,[\].]+?/)).reduce((a, i) => gr(a) ? a : a[i], t);
        return ms(n) || n === t ? ms(t[s]) ? r : t[s] : n
    },
    Qr = t => typeof t == "boolean",
    O0 = t => /^\w*$/.test(t),
    tT = t => Bp(t.replace(/["|']|\]/g, "").split(/\.|\[/)),
    Mt = (t, s, r) => {
        let n = -1;
        const a = O0(s) ? [s] : tT(s),
            i = a.length,
            o = i - 1;
        for (; ++n < i;) {
            const l = a[n];
            let c = r;
            if (n !== o) {
                const d = t[l];
                c = vs(d) || Array.isArray(d) ? d : isNaN(+a[n + 1]) ? {} : []
            }
            if (l === "__proto__" || l === "constructor" || l === "prototype")
                return;
            t[l] = c,
            t = t[l]
        }
    };
const Pf = {
        BLUR: "blur",
        FOCUS_OUT: "focusout",
        CHANGE: "change"
    },
    $n = {
        onBlur: "onBlur",
        onChange: "onChange",
        onSubmit: "onSubmit",
        onTouched: "onTouched",
        all: "all"
    },
    La = {
        max: "max",
        min: "min",

        minLength: "minLength",
        pattern: "pattern",

    },
    sT = ke.createContext(null),
    qp = () => ke.useContext(sT),
    _V = t => {
        const {children: s, ...r} = t;
        return ke.createElement(sT.Provider, {
            value: r
        }, s)
    };
var rT = (t, s, r, n=!0) => {
    const a = {
        defaultValues: s._defaultValues
    };
    for (const i in t)
        Object.defineProperty(a, i, {
            get: () => {
                const o = i;

            }
        });
    return a
};
function TV(t) {
    const s = qp(),
        {control: r=s.control, disabled: n, name: a, exact: i} = t || {},
        [o, l] = ke.useState(r._formState),
        c = ke.useRef({
            isDirty: !1,
            isLoading: !1,
            dirtyFields: !1,
            touchedFields: !1,
            validatingFields: !1,
            isValidating: !1,
            isValid: !1,
            errors: !1
        }),
        d = ke.useRef(a);
    return d.current = a, ke.useEffect(() => r._subscribe({
        name: d.current,
        formState: c.current,
        exact: i,
        callback: u => {
            !n && l({
                ...r._formState,
                ...u
            })
        }
    }), [r, n, i]), ke.useEffect(() => {
        c.current.isValid && r._setValid(!0)
    }, [r]), ke.useMemo(() => rT(o, r, c.current, !1), [o, r])
}
var ga = t => typeof t == "string",
    nT = (t, s, r, n, a) => ga(t) ? (n && s.watch.add(t), _e(r, t, a)) : Array.isArray(t) ? t.map(i => (n && s.watch.add(i), _e(r, i))) : (n && (s.watchAll = !0), r);
function AV(t) {

    }), [r, i, o]);

    return ke.useEffect(() => r._removeUnmounted()), d
}
function MV(t) {

var YV = function(t, s) {

            var n = t[0],
                a = n.code,
                i = n.message,
                o = n.path.join(".");

    },

        return a[i]
    }),

    },

(function(t) {

})(ey || (ey = {}));
const Fe = kt.arrayToEnum(["string", "nan", "number", "integer", "float", "boolean", "date", "bigint", "symbol", "function", "undefined", "null", "array", "object", "unknown", "promise", "void", "never", "map", "set"]),
    Wa = t => {
        switch (typeof t) {
        case "undefined":
            return Fe.undefined;
        case "string":
            return Fe.string;
        case "number":
            return isNaN(t) ? Fe.nan : Fe.number;
        case "boolean":
            return Fe.boolean;
        case "function":
            return Fe.function;
        case "bigint":
            return Fe.bigint;
        case "symbol":
            return Fe.symbol;
        case "object":
            return Array.isArray(t) ? Fe.array : t === null ? Fe.null : t.then && typeof t.then == "function" && t.catch && typeof t.catch == "function" ? Fe.promise : typeof Map < "u" && t instanceof Map ? Fe.map : typeof Set < "u" && t instanceof Set ? Fe.set : typeof Date < "u" && t instanceof Date ? Fe.date : Fe.object;
        default:
            return Fe.unknown
        }
    },
    Ne = kt.arrayToEnum(["invalid_type", "invalid_literal", "custom", "invalid_union", "invalid_union_discriminator", "invalid_enum_value", "unrecognized_keys", "invalid_arguments", "invalid_return_type", "invalid_date", "invalid_string", "too_small", "too_big", "invalid_intersection_types", "not_multiple_of", "not_finite"]),
    ZV = t => JSON.stringify(t, null, 2).replace(/"([^"]+)":/g, "$1:");
class dn extends Error {
    get errors()
    {
        return this.issues
    }
    constructor(s)
    {
        super(),
        this.issues = [],
        this.addIssue = n => {
            this.issues = [...this.issues, n]
        },
        this.addIssues = (n=[]) => {
            this.issues = [...this.issues, ...n]
        };
        const r = new.target.prototype;
        Object.setPrototypeOf ? Object.setPrototypeOf(this, r) : this.__proto__ = r,
        this.name = "ZodError",
        this.issues = s
    }
    format(s)
    {
        const r = s || function(i) {
                return i.message
            },
            n = {
                _errors: []
            },
            a = i => {
                for (const o of i.issues)
                    if (o.code === "invalid_union")
                        o.unionErrors.map(a);
                    else if (o.code === "invalid_return_type")
                        a(o.returnTypeError);
                    else if (o.code === "invalid_arguments")
                        a(o.argumentsError);
                    else if (o.path.length === 0)
                        n._errors.push(r(o));
                    else {
                        let l = n,
                            c = 0;
                        for (; c < o.path.length;) {
                            const d = o.path[c];
                            c === o.path.length - 1 ? (l[d] = l[d] || {
                                _errors: []
                            }, l[d]._errors.push(r(o))) : l[d] = l[d] || {
                                _errors: []
                            },
                            l = l[d],
                            c++
                        }
                    }
            };
        return a(this), n
    }
    static assert(s)
    {
        if (!(s instanceof dn))
            throw new Error(`Not a ZodError: ${s}`)
    }
    toString()
    {
        return this.message
    }
    get message()
    {
        return JSON.stringify(this.issues, kt.jsonStringifyReplacer, 2)
    }
    get isEmpty()
    {
        return this.issues.length === 0
    }
    flatten(s=r => r.message)
    {
        const r = {},
            n = [];
        for (const a of this.issues)
            a.path.length > 0 ? (r[a.path[0]] = r[a.path[0]] || [], r[a.path[0]].push(s(a))) : n.push(s(a));
        return {
            formErrors: n,
            fieldErrors: r
        }
    }
    get formErrors()
    {
        return this.flatten()
    }
}
dn.create = t => new dn(t);
const Dc = (t, s) => {
    let r;
    switch (t.code) {
    case Ne.invalid_type:
        t.received === Fe.undefined ? r = "Required" : r = `Expected ${t.expected}, received ${t.received}`;
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_literal:
        r = `Invalid literal value, expected ${JSON.stringify(t.expected, kt.jsonStringifyReplacer)}`;
        break;
    case Ne.unrecognized_keys:
        r = `Unrecognized key(s) in object: ${kt.joinValues(t.keys, ", ")}`;
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_union:
        r = "Invalid input";
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_union_discriminator:
        r = `Invalid discriminator value. Expected ${kt.joinValues(t.options)}`;
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_enum_value:
        r = `Invalid enum value. Expected ${kt.joinValues(t.options)}, received '${t.received}'`;
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_arguments:
        r = "Invalid function arguments";
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_return_type:
        r = "Invalid function return type";
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_date:
        r = "Invalid date";
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_string:
        typeof t.validation == "object" ? "includes" in t.validation ? (r = `Invalid input: must include "${t.validation.includes}"`, typeof t.validation.position == "number" && (r = `${r} at one or more positions greater than or equal to ${t.validation.position}`)) : "startsWith" in t.validation ? r = `Invalid input: must start with "${t.validation.startsWith}"` : "endsWith" in t.validation ? r = `Invalid input: must end with "${t.validation.endsWith}"` : kt.assertNever(t.validation) : t.validation !== "regex" ? r = `Invalid ${t.validation}` : r = "Invalid";
        break;
    case Ne.too_small:
        t.type === "array" ? r = `Array must contain ${t.exact ? "exactly" : t.inclusive ? "at least" : "more than"} ${t.minimum} element(s)` : t.type === "string" ? r = `String must contain ${t.exact ? "exactly" : t.inclusive ? "at least" : "over"} ${t.minimum} character(s)` : t.type === "number" ? r = `Number must be ${t.exact ? "exactly equal to " : t.inclusive ? "greater than or equal to " : "greater than "}${t.minimum}` : t.type === "date" ? r = `Date must be ${t.exact ? "exactly equal to " : t.inclusive ? "greater than or equal to " : "greater than "}${new Date(Number(t.minimum))}` : r = "Invalid input";
        break;
    case Ne.too_big:
        t.type === "array" ? r = `Array must contain ${t.exact ? "exactly" : t.inclusive ? "at most" : "less than"} ${t.maximum} element(s)` : t.type === "string" ? r = `String must contain ${t.exact ? "exactly" : t.inclusive ? "at most" : "under"} ${t.maximum} character(s)` : t.type === "number" ? r = `Number must be ${t.exact ? "exactly" : t.inclusive ? "less than or equal to" : "less than"} ${t.maximum}` : t.type === "bigint" ? r = `BigInt must be ${t.exact ? "exactly" : t.inclusive ? "less than or equal to" : "less than"} ${t.maximum}` : t.type === "date" ? r = `Date must be ${t.exact ? "exactly" : t.inclusive ? "smaller than or equal to" : "smaller than"} ${new Date(Number(t.maximum))}` : r = "Invalid input";
        break;
    case Ne.custom:
        r = "Invalid input";
        break;
    case Ne.invalid_intersection_types:
        r = "Intersection results could not be merged";
        break;
    case Ne.not_multiple_of:
        r = `Number must be a multiple of ${t.multipleOf}`;
        break;
    case Ne.not_finite:
        r = "Number must be finite";
        break;
    default:
        r = s.defaultError,
        kt.assertNever(t)
    }
    return {
        message: r
    }
};

    hT = t
}
function Mf() {
    return hT
}
const Rf = t => {
        const {data: s, path: r, errorMaps: n, issueData: a} = t,

            };

            l = d(o, {
                data: s,
                defaultError: l
            }).message;
        return {
            ...a,
            path: i,
            message: l
        }
    },
    XV = [];
function Ae(t, s) {

class cr {
    constructor()
    {
        this.value = "valid"
    }
    dirty()
    {
        this.value === "valid" && (this.value = "dirty")
    }
    abort()
    {
        this.value !== "aborted" && (this.value = "aborted")
    }
    static mergeArray(s, r)
    {
        const n = [];
        for (const a of r) {
            if (a.status === "aborted")
                return it;
            a.status === "dirty" && s.dirty(),
            n.push(a.value)
        }
        return {
            status: s.value,
            value: n
        }
    }
    static async mergeObjectAsync(s, r)
    {
        const n = [];
        for (const a of r) {
            const i = await a.key,
                o = await a.value;
            n.push({
                key: i,
                value: o
            })
        }
        return cr.mergeObjectSync(s, n)
    }
    static mergeObjectSync(s, r)
    {
        const n = {};
        for (const a of r) {
            const {key: i, value: o} = a;
            if (i.status === "aborted" || o.status === "aborted")
                return it;
            i.status === "dirty" && s.dirty(),
            o.status === "dirty" && s.dirty(),
            i.value !== "__proto__" && (typeof o.value < "u" || a.alwaysSet) && (n[i.value] = o.value)
        }
        return {
            status: s.value,
            value: n
        }
    }
}

function ht(t) {

        return {};

        throw new Error(`Can't use "invalid_type_error" or "required_error" in conjunction with custom error map.`);

        errorMap: s,

    } : {

                d;

function xT(t) {
    let s = "([01]\\d|2[0-3]):[0-5]\\d:[0-5]\\d";
    return t.precision ? s = `${s}\\.\\d{${t.precision}}` : t.precision == null && (s = `${s}(\\.\\d+)?`), s

function p9(t) {
    return new RegExp(`^${xT(t)}$`)
}
function gT(t) {

function g9(t, s) {

        return !(typeof a != "object" || a === null || !a.typ || !a.alg || s && a.alg !== s)

    }

function y9(t, s) {
    const r = (t.toString().split(".")[1] || "").length,
        n = (s.toString().split(".")[1] || "").length,
        a = r > n ? r : n,
        i = parseInt(t.toFixed(a).replace(".", "")),
        o = parseInt(s.toFixed(a).replace(".", ""));
    return i % o / Math.pow(10, a)
}
class mo extends vt {
    constructor()
    {
        super(...arguments),
        this.min = this.gte,
        this.max = this.lte,
        this.step = this.multipleOf
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (this._def.coerce && (s.data = Number(s.data)), this._getType(s) !== Fe.number) {
            const i = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(i, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.number,
                received: i.parsedType
            }), it
        }
        let n;
        const a = new cr;
        for (const i of this._def.checks)
            i.kind === "int" ? kt.isInteger(s.data) || (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: "integer",
                received: "float",
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : i.kind === "min" ? (i.inclusive ? s.data < i.value : s.data <= i.value) && (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.too_small,
                minimum: i.value,
                type: "number",
                inclusive: i.inclusive,
                exact: !1,
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : i.kind === "max" ? (i.inclusive ? s.data > i.value : s.data >= i.value) && (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.too_big,
                maximum: i.value,
                type: "number",
                inclusive: i.inclusive,
                exact: !1,
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : i.kind === "multipleOf" ? y9(s.data, i.value) !== 0 && (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.not_multiple_of,
                multipleOf: i.value,
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : i.kind === "finite" ? Number.isFinite(s.data) || (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.not_finite,
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : kt.assertNever(i);
        return {
            status: a.value,
            value: s.data
        }
    }
    gte(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("min", s, !0, Be.toString(r))
    }
    gt(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("min", s, !1, Be.toString(r))
    }
    lte(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("max", s, !0, Be.toString(r))
    }
    lt(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("max", s, !1, Be.toString(r))
    }
    setLimit(s, r, n, a)
    {
        return new mo({
            ...this._def,
            checks: [...this._def.checks, {
                kind: s,
                value: r,
                inclusive: n,
                message: Be.toString(a)
            }]
        })
    }
    _addCheck(s)
    {
        return new mo({
            ...this._def,
            checks: [...this._def.checks, s]
        })
    }
    int(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "int",
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    positive(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "min",
            value: 0,
            inclusive: !1,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    negative(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "max",
            value: 0,
            inclusive: !1,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    nonpositive(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "max",
            value: 0,
            inclusive: !0,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    nonnegative(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "min",
            value: 0,
            inclusive: !0,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    multipleOf(s, r)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "multipleOf",
            value: s,
            message: Be.toString(r)
        })
    }
    finite(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "finite",
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    safe(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "min",
            inclusive: !0,
            value: Number.MIN_SAFE_INTEGER,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })._addCheck({
            kind: "max",
            inclusive: !0,
            value: Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    get minValue()
    {
        let s = null;
        for (const r of this._def.checks)
            r.kind === "min" && (s === null || r.value > s) && (s = r.value);
        return s
    }
    get maxValue()
    {
        let s = null;
        for (const r of this._def.checks)
            r.kind === "max" && (s === null || r.value < s) && (s = r.value);
        return s
    }
    get isInt()
    {
        return !!this._def.checks.find(s => s.kind === "int" || s.kind === "multipleOf" && kt.isInteger(s.value))
    }
    get isFinite()
    {
        let s = null,
            r = null;
        for (const n of this._def.checks) {
            if (n.kind === "finite" || n.kind === "int" || n.kind === "multipleOf")
                return !0;
            n.kind === "min" ? (r === null || n.value > r) && (r = n.value) : n.kind === "max" && (s === null || n.value < s) && (s = n.value)
        }
        return Number.isFinite(r) && Number.isFinite(s)
    }
}
mo.create = t => new mo({
    checks: [],
    typeName: nt.ZodNumber,
    coerce: (t == null ? void 0 : t.coerce) || !1,
    ...ht(t)
});
class ho extends vt {
    constructor()
    {
        super(...arguments),
        this.min = this.gte,
        this.max = this.lte
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (this._def.coerce)
            try {
                s.data = BigInt(s.data)
            } catch {
                return this._getInvalidInput(s)
            }
        if (this._getType(s) !== Fe.bigint)
            return this._getInvalidInput(s);
        let n;
        const a = new cr;
        for (const i of this._def.checks)
            i.kind === "min" ? (i.inclusive ? s.data < i.value : s.data <= i.value) && (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.too_small,
                type: "bigint",
                minimum: i.value,
                inclusive: i.inclusive,
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : i.kind === "max" ? (i.inclusive ? s.data > i.value : s.data >= i.value) && (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.too_big,
                type: "bigint",
                maximum: i.value,
                inclusive: i.inclusive,
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : i.kind === "multipleOf" ? s.data % i.value !== BigInt(0) && (n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, n), Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.not_multiple_of,
                multipleOf: i.value,
                message: i.message
            }), a.dirty()) : kt.assertNever(i);
        return {
            status: a.value,
            value: s.data
        }
    }
    _getInvalidInput(s)
    {
        const r = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
        return Ae(r, {
            code: Ne.invalid_type,
            expected: Fe.bigint,
            received: r.parsedType
        }), it
    }
    gte(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("min", s, !0, Be.toString(r))
    }
    gt(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("min", s, !1, Be.toString(r))
    }
    lte(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("max", s, !0, Be.toString(r))
    }
    lt(s, r)
    {
        return this.setLimit("max", s, !1, Be.toString(r))
    }
    setLimit(s, r, n, a)
    {
        return new ho({
            ...this._def,
            checks: [...this._def.checks, {
                kind: s,
                value: r,
                inclusive: n,
                message: Be.toString(a)
            }]
        })
    }
    _addCheck(s)
    {
        return new ho({
            ...this._def,
            checks: [...this._def.checks, s]
        })
    }
    positive(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "min",
            value: BigInt(0),
            inclusive: !1,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    negative(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "max",
            value: BigInt(0),
            inclusive: !1,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    nonpositive(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "max",
            value: BigInt(0),
            inclusive: !0,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    nonnegative(s)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "min",
            value: BigInt(0),
            inclusive: !0,
            message: Be.toString(s)
        })
    }
    multipleOf(s, r)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "multipleOf",
            value: s,
            message: Be.toString(r)
        })
    }
    get minValue()
    {
        let s = null;
        for (const r of this._def.checks)
            r.kind === "min" && (s === null || r.value > s) && (s = r.value);
        return s
    }
    get maxValue()
    {
        let s = null;
        for (const r of this._def.checks)
            r.kind === "max" && (s === null || r.value < s) && (s = r.value);
        return s
    }
}
ho.create = t => {
    var s;
    return new ho({
        checks: [],
        typeName: nt.ZodBigInt,
        coerce: (s = t == null ? void 0 : t.coerce) !== null && s !== void 0 ? s : !1,
        ...ht(t)
    })
};
class Au extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (this._def.coerce && (s.data = !!s.data), this._getType(s) !== Fe.boolean) {
            const n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.boolean,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it
        }
        return Er(s.data)
    }
}
Au.create = t => new Au({
    typeName: nt.ZodBoolean,
    coerce: (t == null ? void 0 : t.coerce) || !1,
    ...ht(t)
});
class cl extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (this._def.coerce && (s.data = new Date(s.data)), this._getType(s) !== Fe.date) {
            const i = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(i, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.date,
                received: i.parsedType
            }), it
        }
        if (isNaN(s.data.getTime())) {
            const i = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(i, {
                code: Ne.invalid_date
            }), it
        }
        const n = new cr;
        let a;
        for (const i of this._def.checks)
            i.kind === "min" ? s.data.getTime() < i.value && (a = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, a), Ae(a, {
                code: Ne.too_small,
                message: i.message,
                inclusive: !0,
                exact: !1,
                minimum: i.value,
                type: "date"
            }), n.dirty()) : i.kind === "max" ? s.data.getTime() > i.value && (a = this._getOrReturnCtx(s, a), Ae(a, {
                code: Ne.too_big,
                message: i.message,
                inclusive: !0,
                exact: !1,
                maximum: i.value,
                type: "date"
            }), n.dirty()) : kt.assertNever(i);
        return {
            status: n.value,
            value: new Date(s.data.getTime())
        }
    }
    _addCheck(s)
    {
        return new cl({
            ...this._def,
            checks: [...this._def.checks, s]
        })
    }
    min(s, r)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "min",
            value: s.getTime(),
            message: Be.toString(r)
        })
    }
    max(s, r)
    {
        return this._addCheck({
            kind: "max",
            value: s.getTime(),
            message: Be.toString(r)
        })
    }
    get minDate()
    {
        let s = null;
        for (const r of this._def.checks)
            r.kind === "min" && (s === null || r.value > s) && (s = r.value);
        return s != null ? new Date(s) : null
    }
    get maxDate()
    {
        let s = null;
        for (const r of this._def.checks)
            r.kind === "max" && (s === null || r.value < s) && (s = r.value);
        return s != null ? new Date(s) : null
    }
}
cl.create = t => new cl({
    checks: [],
    coerce: (t == null ? void 0 : t.coerce) || !1,
    typeName: nt.ZodDate,
    ...ht(t)
});

                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.symbol,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it
        }

    }

    }

class gi extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const r = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
        return Ae(r, {
            code: Ne.invalid_type,
            expected: Fe.never,
            received: r.parsedType
        }), it
    }
}
gi.create = t => new gi({
    typeName: nt.ZodNever,
    ...ht(t)
});
class Of extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (this._getType(s) !== Fe.undefined) {
            const n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.void,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it
        }
        return Er(s.data)
    }
}
Of.create = t => new Of({
    typeName: nt.ZodVoid,
    ...ht(t)
});
class Wn extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {ctx: r, status: n} = this._processInputParams(s),
            a = this._def;
        if (r.parsedType !== Fe.array)
            return Ae(r, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.array,
                received: r.parsedType
            }), it;
        if (a.exactLength !== null) {
            const o = r.data.length > a.exactLength.value,
                l = r.data.length < a.exactLength.value;
            (o || l) && (Ae(r, {
                code: o ? Ne.too_big : Ne.too_small,
                minimum: l ? a.exactLength.value : void 0,
                maximum: o ? a.exactLength.value : void 0,
                type: "array",
                inclusive: !0,
                exact: !0,
                message: a.exactLength.message
            }), n.dirty())
        }
        if (a.minLength !== null && r.data.length < a.minLength.value && (Ae(r, {
            code: Ne.too_small,
            minimum: a.minLength.value,
            type: "array",
            inclusive: !0,
            exact: !1,
            message: a.minLength.message
        }), n.dirty()), a.maxLength !== null && r.data.length > a.maxLength.value && (Ae(r, {
            code: Ne.too_big,
            maximum: a.maxLength.value,
            type: "array",
            inclusive: !0,
            exact: !1,
            message: a.maxLength.message
        }), n.dirty()), r.common.async)
            return Promise.all([...r.data].map((o, l) => a.type._parseAsync(new Pa(r, o, r.path, l)))).then(o => cr.mergeArray(n, o));
        const i = [...r.data].map((o, l) => a.type._parseSync(new Pa(r, o, r.path, l)));
        return cr.mergeArray(n, i)
    }
    get element()
    {
        return this._def.type
    }
    min(s, r)
    {
        return new Wn({
            ...this._def,
            minLength: {
                value: s,
                message: Be.toString(r)
            }
        })
    }
    max(s, r)
    {
        return new Wn({
            ...this._def,
            maxLength: {
                value: s,
                message: Be.toString(r)
            }
        })
    }
    length(s, r)
    {
        return new Wn({
            ...this._def,
            exactLength: {
                value: s,
                message: Be.toString(r)
            }
        })
    }
    nonempty(s)
    {
        return this.min(1, s)
    }
}
Wn.create = (t, s) => new Wn({
    type: t,
    minLength: null,
    maxLength: null,
    exactLength: null,
    typeName: nt.ZodArray,
    ...ht(s)
});
function Tl(t) {
    if (t instanceof ss) {
        const s = {};
        for (const r in t.shape) {
            const n = t.shape[r];
            s[r] = Ca.create(Tl(n))
        }
        return new ss({
            ...t._def,
            shape: () => s
        })
    } else
        return t instanceof Wn ? new Wn({
            ...t._def,
            type: Tl(t.element)
        }) : t instanceof Ca ? Ca.create(Tl(t.unwrap())) : t instanceof po ? po.create(Tl(t.unwrap())) : t instanceof _a ? _a.create(t.items.map(s => Tl(s))) : t
}
class ss extends vt {
    constructor()
    {
        super(...arguments),
        this._cached = null,
        this.nonstrict = this.passthrough,
        this.augment = this.extend
    }
    _getCached()
    {
        if (this._cached !== null)
            return this._cached;
        const s = this._def.shape(),
            r = kt.objectKeys(s);
        return this._cached = {
            shape: s,
            keys: r
        }
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (this._getType(s) !== Fe.object) {
            const d = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(d, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.object,
                received: d.parsedType
            }), it
        }
        const {status: n, ctx: a} = this._processInputParams(s),
            {shape: i, keys: o} = this._getCached(),
            l = [];
        if (!(this._def.catchall instanceof gi && this._def.unknownKeys === "strip"))
            for (const d in a.data)
                o.includes(d) || l.push(d);
        const c = [];
        for (const d of o) {
            const u = i[d],
                m = a.data[d];
            c.push({
                key: {
                    status: "valid",
                    value: d
                },
                value: u._parse(new Pa(a, m, a.path, d)),
                alwaysSet: d in a.data
            })
        }
        if (this._def.catchall instanceof gi) {
            const d = this._def.unknownKeys;
            if (d === "passthrough")
                for (const u of l)
                    c.push({
                        key: {
                            status: "valid",
                            value: u
                        },
                        value: {
                            status: "valid",
                            value: a.data[u]
                        }
                    });
            else if (d === "strict")
                l.length > 0 && (Ae(a, {
                    code: Ne.unrecognized_keys,
                    keys: l
                }), n.dirty());
            else if (d !== "strip")
                throw new Error("Internal ZodObject error: invalid unknownKeys value.")
        } else {
            const d = this._def.catchall;
            for (const u of l) {
                const m = a.data[u];
                c.push({
                    key: {
                        status: "valid",
                        value: u
                    },
                    value: d._parse(new Pa(a, m, a.path, u)),
                    alwaysSet: u in a.data
                })
            }
        }
        return a.common.async ? Promise.resolve().then(async () => {
            const d = [];
            for (const u of c) {
                const m = await u.key,
                    p = await u.value;
                d.push({
                    key: m,
                    value: p,
                    alwaysSet: u.alwaysSet
                })
            }
            return d
        }).then(d => cr.mergeObjectSync(n, d)) : cr.mergeObjectSync(n, c)
    }
    get shape()
    {
        return this._def.shape()
    }
    strict(s)
    {
        return Be.errToObj, new ss({
            ...this._def,
            unknownKeys: "strict",
            ...s !== void 0 ? {
                errorMap: (r, n) => {
                    var a,
                        i,
                        o,
                        l;
                    const c = (o = (i = (a = this._def).errorMap) === null || i === void 0 ? void 0 : i.call(a, r, n).message) !== null && o !== void 0 ? o : n.defaultError;
                    return r.code === "unrecognized_keys" ? {
                        message: (l = Be.errToObj(s).message) !== null && l !== void 0 ? l : c
                    } : {
                        message: c
                    }
                }
            } : {}
        })
    }
    strip()
    {
        return new ss({
            ...this._def,
            unknownKeys: "strip"
        })
    }
    passthrough()
    {
        return new ss({
            ...this._def,
            unknownKeys: "passthrough"
        })
    }
    extend(s)
    {
        return new ss({
            ...this._def,
            shape: () => ({
                ...this._def.shape(),
                ...s
            })
        })
    }
    merge(s)
    {
        return new ss({
            unknownKeys: s._def.unknownKeys,
            catchall: s._def.catchall,
            shape: () => ({
                ...this._def.shape(),
                ...s._def.shape()
            }),
            typeName: nt.ZodObject
        })
    }
    setKey(s, r)
    {
        return this.augment({
            [s]: r
        })
    }
    catchall(s)
    {
        return new ss({
            ...this._def,
            catchall: s
        })
    }
    pick(s)
    {
        const r = {};
        return kt.objectKeys(s).forEach(n => {
            s[n] && this.shape[n] && (r[n] = this.shape[n])
        }), new ss({
            ...this._def,
            shape: () => r
        })
    }
    omit(s)
    {
        const r = {};
        return kt.objectKeys(this.shape).forEach(n => {
            s[n] || (r[n] = this.shape[n])
        }), new ss({
            ...this._def,
            shape: () => r
        })
    }
    deepPartial()
    {
        return Tl(this)
    }
    partial(s)
    {
        const r = {};
        return kt.objectKeys(this.shape).forEach(n => {
            const a = this.shape[n];
            s && !s[n] ? r[n] = a : r[n] = a.optional()
        }), new ss({
            ...this._def,
            shape: () => r
        })
    }
    required(s)
    {
        const r = {};
        return kt.objectKeys(this.shape).forEach(n => {
            if (s && !s[n])
                r[n] = this.shape[n];
            else {
                let i = this.shape[n];
                for (; i instanceof Ca;)
                    i = i._def.innerType;
                r[n] = i
            }
        }), new ss({
            ...this._def,
            shape: () => r
        })
    }
    keyof()
    {
        return vT(kt.objectKeys(this.shape))
    }
}
ss.create = (t, s) => new ss({
    shape: () => t,
    unknownKeys: "strip",
    catchall: gi.create(),
    typeName: nt.ZodObject,
    ...ht(s)
});
ss.strictCreate = (t, s) => new ss({
    shape: () => t,
    unknownKeys: "strict",
    catchall: gi.create(),
    typeName: nt.ZodObject,
    ...ht(s)
});
ss.lazycreate = (t, s) => new ss({
    shape: t,
    unknownKeys: "strip",
    catchall: gi.create(),
    typeName: nt.ZodObject,
    ...ht(s)
});
class Iu extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {ctx: r} = this._processInputParams(s),
            n = this._def.options;
        function a(i) {
            for (const l of i)
                if (l.result.status === "valid")
                    return l.result;
            for (const l of i)
                if (l.result.status === "dirty")
                    return r.common.issues.push(...l.ctx.common.issues), l.result;
            const o = i.map(l => new dn(l.ctx.common.issues));
            return Ae(r, {
                code: Ne.invalid_union,
                unionErrors: o
            }), it
        }
        if (r.common.async)
            return Promise.all(n.map(async i => {
                const o = {
                    ...r,
                    common: {
                        ...r.common,
                        issues: []
                    },
                    parent: null
                };
                return {
                    result: await i._parseAsync({
                        data: r.data,
                        path: r.path,
                        parent: o
                    }),
                    ctx: o
                }
            })).then(a);
        {
            let i;
            const o = [];
            for (const c of n) {
                const d = {
                        ...r,
                        common: {
                            ...r.common,
                            issues: []
                        },
                        parent: null
                    },
                    u = c._parseSync({
                        data: r.data,
                        path: r.path,
                        parent: d
                    });
                if (u.status === "valid")
                    return u;
                u.status === "dirty" && !i && (i = {
                    result: u,
                    ctx: d
                }),
                d.common.issues.length && o.push(d.common.issues)
            }
            if (i)
                return r.common.issues.push(...i.ctx.common.issues), i.result;
            const l = o.map(c => new dn(c));
            return Ae(r, {
                code: Ne.invalid_union,
                unionErrors: l
            }), it
        }
    }
    get options()
    {
        return this._def.options
    }
}
Iu.create = (t, s) => new Iu({
    options: t,
    typeName: nt.ZodUnion,
    ...ht(s)
});
const Va = t => t instanceof Lu ? Va(t.schema) : t instanceof Qn ? Va(t.innerType()) : t instanceof Fu ? [t.value] : t instanceof fo ? t.options : t instanceof zu ? kt.objectValues(t.enum) : t instanceof $u ? Va(t._def.innerType) : t instanceof Mu ? [void 0] : t instanceof Ru ? [null] : t instanceof Ca ? [void 0, ...Va(t.unwrap())] : t instanceof po ? [null, ...Va(t.unwrap())] : t instanceof z0 || t instanceof Uu ? Va(t.unwrap()) : t instanceof Vu ? Va(t._def.innerType) : [];
class Hp extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {ctx: r} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (r.parsedType !== Fe.object)
            return Ae(r, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.object,
                received: r.parsedType
            }), it;
        const n = this.discriminator,
            a = r.data[n],
            i = this.optionsMap.get(a);
        return i ? r.common.async ? i._parseAsync({
            data: r.data,
            path: r.path,
            parent: r
        }) : i._parseSync({
            data: r.data,
            path: r.path,
            parent: r
        }) : (Ae(r, {
            code: Ne.invalid_union_discriminator,
            options: Array.from(this.optionsMap.keys()),
            path: [n]
        }), it)
    }
    get discriminator()
    {
        return this._def.discriminator
    }
    get options()
    {
        return this._def.options
    }
    get optionsMap()
    {
        return this._def.optionsMap
    }
    static create(s, r, n)
    {
        const a = new Map;
        for (const i of r) {
            const o = Va(i.shape[s]);
            if (!o.length)
                throw new Error(`A discriminator value for key \`${s}\` could not be extracted from all schema options`);
            for (const l of o) {
                if (a.has(l))
                    throw new Error(`Discriminator property ${String(s)} has duplicate value ${String(l)}`);
                a.set(l, i)
            }
        }
        return new Hp({
            typeName: nt.ZodDiscriminatedUnion,
            discriminator: s,
            options: r,
            optionsMap: a,
            ...ht(n)
        })
    }
}
function ry(t, s) {
    const r = Wa(t),
        n = Wa(s);
    if (t === s)
        return {
            valid: !0,
            data: t
        };
    if (r === Fe.object && n === Fe.object) {
        const a = kt.objectKeys(s),
            i = kt.objectKeys(t).filter(l => a.indexOf(l) !== -1),
            o = {
                ...t,
                ...s
            };
        for (const l of i) {
            const c = ry(t[l], s[l]);
            if (!c.valid)
                return {
                    valid: !1
                };
            o[l] = c.data
        }
        return {
            valid: !0,
            data: o
        }
    } else if (r === Fe.array && n === Fe.array) {
        if (t.length !== s.length)
            return {
                valid: !1
            };
        const a = [];
        for (let i = 0; i < t.length; i++) {
            const o = t[i],
                l = s[i],
                c = ry(o, l);
            if (!c.valid)
                return {
                    valid: !1
                };
            a.push(c.data)
        }
        return {
            valid: !0,
            data: a
        }
    } else
        return r === Fe.date && n === Fe.date && +t == +s ? {
            valid: !0,
            data: t
        } : {
            valid: !1
        }
}
class Du extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {status: r, ctx: n} = this._processInputParams(s),
            a = (i, o) => {
                if (ty(i) || ty(o))
                    return it;
                const l = ry(i.value, o.value);
                return l.valid ? ((sy(i) || sy(o)) && r.dirty(), {
                    status: r.value,
                    value: l.data
                }) : (Ae(n, {
                    code: Ne.invalid_intersection_types
                }), it)
            };
        return n.common.async ? Promise.all([this._def.left._parseAsync({
            data: n.data,
            path: n.path,
            parent: n
        }), this._def.right._parseAsync({
            data: n.data,
            path: n.path,
            parent: n
        })]).then(([i, o]) => a(i, o)) : a(this._def.left._parseSync({
            data: n.data,
            path: n.path,
            parent: n
        }), this._def.right._parseSync({
            data: n.data,
            path: n.path,
            parent: n
        }))
    }
}
Du.create = (t, s, r) => new Du({
    left: t,
    right: s,
    typeName: nt.ZodIntersection,
    ...ht(r)
});
class _a extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {status: r, ctx: n} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (n.parsedType !== Fe.array)
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.array,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it;
        if (n.data.length < this._def.items.length)
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.too_small,
                minimum: this._def.items.length,
                inclusive: !0,
                exact: !1,
                type: "array"
            }), it;
        !this._def.rest && n.data.length > this._def.items.length && (Ae(n, {
            code: Ne.too_big,
            maximum: this._def.items.length,
            inclusive: !0,
            exact: !1,
            type: "array"
        }), r.dirty());
        const i = [...n.data].map((o, l) => {
            const c = this._def.items[l] || this._def.rest;
            return c ? c._parse(new Pa(n, o, n.path, l)) : null
        }).filter(o => !!o);
        return n.common.async ? Promise.all(i).then(o => cr.mergeArray(r, o)) : cr.mergeArray(r, i)
    }
    get items()
    {
        return this._def.items
    }
    rest(s)
    {
        return new _a({
            ...this._def,
            rest: s
        })
    }
}
_a.create = (t, s) => {
    if (!Array.isArray(t))
        throw new Error("You must pass an array of schemas to z.tuple([ ... ])");
    return new _a({
        items: t,
        typeName: nt.ZodTuple,
        rest: null,
        ...ht(s)
    })
};
class Ou extends vt {
    get keySchema()
    {
        return this._def.keyType
    }
    get valueSchema()
    {
        return this._def.valueType
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {status: r, ctx: n} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (n.parsedType !== Fe.object)
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.object,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it;
        const a = [],
            i = this._def.keyType,
            o = this._def.valueType;
        for (const l in n.data)
            a.push({
                key: i._parse(new Pa(n, l, n.path, l)),
                value: o._parse(new Pa(n, n.data[l], n.path, l)),
                alwaysSet: l in n.data
            });
        return n.common.async ? cr.mergeObjectAsync(r, a) : cr.mergeObjectSync(r, a)
    }
    get element()
    {
        return this._def.valueType
    }
    static create(s, r, n)
    {
        return r instanceof vt ? new Ou({
            keyType: s,
            valueType: r,
            typeName: nt.ZodRecord,
            ...ht(n)
        }) : new Ou({
            keyType: Un.create(),
            valueType: s,
            typeName: nt.ZodRecord,
            ...ht(r)
        })
    }
}
class Lf extends vt {
    get keySchema()
    {
        return this._def.keyType
    }
    get valueSchema()
    {
        return this._def.valueType
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {status: r, ctx: n} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (n.parsedType !== Fe.map)
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.map,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it;
        const a = this._def.keyType,
            i = this._def.valueType,
            o = [...n.data.entries()].map(([l, c], d) => ({
                key: a._parse(new Pa(n, l, n.path, [d, "key"])),
                value: i._parse(new Pa(n, c, n.path, [d, "value"]))
            }));
        if (n.common.async) {
            const l = new Map;
            return Promise.resolve().then(async () => {
                for (const c of o) {
                    const d = await c.key,
                        u = await c.value;
                    if (d.status === "aborted" || u.status === "aborted")
                        return it;
                    (d.status === "dirty" || u.status === "dirty") && r.dirty(),
                    l.set(d.value, u.value)
                }
                return {
                    status: r.value,
                    value: l
                }
            })
        } else {
            const l = new Map;
            for (const c of o) {
                const d = c.key,
                    u = c.value;
                if (d.status === "aborted" || u.status === "aborted")
                    return it;
                (d.status === "dirty" || u.status === "dirty") && r.dirty(),
                l.set(d.value, u.value)
            }
            return {
                status: r.value,
                value: l
            }
        }
    }
}
Lf.create = (t, s, r) => new Lf({
    valueType: s,
    keyType: t,
    typeName: nt.ZodMap,
    ...ht(r)
});
class dl extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {status: r, ctx: n} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (n.parsedType !== Fe.set)
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.set,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it;
        const a = this._def;
        a.minSize !== null && n.data.size < a.minSize.value && (Ae(n, {
            code: Ne.too_small,
            minimum: a.minSize.value,
            type: "set",
            inclusive: !0,
            exact: !1,
            message: a.minSize.message
        }), r.dirty()),
        a.maxSize !== null && n.data.size > a.maxSize.value && (Ae(n, {
            code: Ne.too_big,
            maximum: a.maxSize.value,
            type: "set",
            inclusive: !0,
            exact: !1,
            message: a.maxSize.message
        }), r.dirty());
        const i = this._def.valueType;
        function o(c) {
            const d = new Set;
            for (const u of c) {
                if (u.status === "aborted")
                    return it;
                u.status === "dirty" && r.dirty(),
                d.add(u.value)
            }
            return {
                status: r.value,
                value: d
            }
        }
        const l = [...n.data.values()].map((c, d) => i._parse(new Pa(n, c, n.path, d)));
        return n.common.async ? Promise.all(l).then(c => o(c)) : o(l)
    }
    min(s, r)
    {
        return new dl({
            ...this._def,
            minSize: {
                value: s,
                message: Be.toString(r)
            }
        })
    }
    max(s, r)
    {
        return new dl({
            ...this._def,
            maxSize: {
                value: s,
                message: Be.toString(r)
            }
        })
    }
    size(s, r)
    {
        return this.min(s, r).max(s, r)
    }
    nonempty(s)
    {
        return this.min(1, s)
    }
}
dl.create = (t, s) => new dl({
    valueType: t,
    minSize: null,
    maxSize: null,
    typeName: nt.ZodSet,
    ...ht(s)
});
class tc extends vt {
    constructor()
    {
        super(...arguments),
        this.validate = this.implement
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {ctx: r} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (r.parsedType !== Fe.function)
            return Ae(r, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.function,
                received: r.parsedType
            }), it;
        function n(l, c) {
            return Rf({
                data: l,
                path: r.path,
                errorMaps: [r.common.contextualErrorMap, r.schemaErrorMap, Mf(), Dc].filter(d => !!d),
                issueData: {
                    code: Ne.invalid_arguments,
                    argumentsError: c
                }
            })
        }
        function a(l, c) {
            return Rf({
                data: l,
                path: r.path,
                errorMaps: [r.common.contextualErrorMap, r.schemaErrorMap, Mf(), Dc].filter(d => !!d),
                issueData: {
                    code: Ne.invalid_return_type,
                    returnTypeError: c
                }
            })
        }
        const i = {
                errorMap: r.common.contextualErrorMap
            },
            o = r.data;
        if (this._def.returns instanceof Lc) {
            const l = this;
            return Er(async function(...c) {
                const d = new dn([]),
                    u = await l._def.args.parseAsync(c, i).catch(y => {
                        throw d.addIssue(n(c, y)), d
                    }),
                    m = await Reflect.apply(o, this, u);
                return await l._def.returns._def.type.parseAsync(m, i).catch(y => {
                    throw d.addIssue(a(m, y)), d
                })
            })
        } else {
            const l = this;
            return Er(function(...c) {
                const d = l._def.args.safeParse(c, i);
                if (!d.success)
                    throw new dn([n(c, d.error)]);
                const u = Reflect.apply(o, this, d.data),
                    m = l._def.returns.safeParse(u, i);
                if (!m.success)
                    throw new dn([a(u, m.error)]);
                return m.data
            })
        }
    }
    parameters()
    {
        return this._def.args
    }
    returnType()
    {
        return this._def.returns
    }
    args(...s)
    {
        return new tc({
            ...this._def,
            args: _a.create(s).rest(Ko.create())
        })
    }
    returns(s)
    {
        return new tc({
            ...this._def,
            returns: s
        })
    }
    implement(s)
    {
        return this.parse(s)
    }
    strictImplement(s)
    {
        return this.parse(s)
    }
    static create(s, r, n)
    {
        return new tc({
            args: s || _a.create([]).rest(Ko.create()),
            returns: r || Ko.create(),
            typeName: nt.ZodFunction,
            ...ht(n)
        })
    }
}
class Lu extends vt {
    get schema()
    {
        return this._def.getter()
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {ctx: r} = this._processInputParams(s);
        return this._def.getter()._parse({
            data: r.data,
            path: r.path,
            parent: r
        })
    }
}
Lu.create = (t, s) => new Lu({
    getter: t,
    typeName: nt.ZodLazy,
    ...ht(s)
});
class Fu extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (s.data !== this._def.value) {
            const r = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(r, {
                received: r.data,
                code: Ne.invalid_literal,
                expected: this._def.value
            }), it
        }
        return {
            status: "valid",
            value: s.data
        }
    }
    get value()
    {
        return this._def.value
    }
}
Fu.create = (t, s) => new Fu({
    value: t,
    typeName: nt.ZodLiteral,
    ...ht(s)
});
function vT(t, s) {
    return new fo({
        values: t,
        typeName: nt.ZodEnum,
        ...ht(s)
    })
}
class fo extends vt {
    constructor()
    {
        super(...arguments),
        Id.set(this, void 0)
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        if (typeof s.data != "string") {
            const r = this._getOrReturnCtx(s),
                n = this._def.values;
            return Ae(r, {
                expected: kt.joinValues(n),
                received: r.parsedType,
                code: Ne.invalid_type
            }), it
        }
        if (If(this, Id) || fT(this, Id, new Set(this._def.values)), !If(this, Id).has(s.data)) {
            const r = this._getOrReturnCtx(s),
                n = this._def.values;
            return Ae(r, {
                received: r.data,
                code: Ne.invalid_enum_value,
                options: n
            }), it
        }
        return Er(s.data)
    }
    get options()
    {
        return this._def.values
    }
    get enum()
    {
        const s = {};
        for (const r of this._def.values)
            s[r] = r;
        return s
    }
    get Values()
    {
        const s = {};
        for (const r of this._def.values)
            s[r] = r;
        return s
    }
    get Enum()
    {
        const s = {};
        for (const r of this._def.values)
            s[r] = r;
        return s
    }
    extract(s, r=this._def)
    {
        return fo.create(s, {
            ...this._def,
            ...r
        })
    }
    exclude(s, r=this._def)
    {
        return fo.create(this.options.filter(n => !s.includes(n)), {
            ...this._def,
            ...r
        })
    }
}
Id = new WeakMap;
fo.create = vT;
class zu extends vt {
    constructor()
    {
        super(...arguments),
        Dd.set(this, void 0)
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        const r = kt.getValidEnumValues(this._def.values),
            n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
        if (n.parsedType !== Fe.string && n.parsedType !== Fe.number) {
            const a = kt.objectValues(r);
            return Ae(n, {
                expected: kt.joinValues(a),
                received: n.parsedType,
                code: Ne.invalid_type
            }), it
        }
        if (If(this, Dd) || fT(this, Dd, new Set(kt.getValidEnumValues(this._def.values))), !If(this, Dd).has(s.data)) {
            const a = kt.objectValues(r);
            return Ae(n, {
                received: n.data,
                code: Ne.invalid_enum_value,
                options: a
            }), it
        }
        return Er(s.data)
    }
    get enum()
    {
        return this._def.values
    }
}
Dd = new WeakMap;
zu.create = (t, s) => new zu({
    values: t,
    typeName: nt.ZodNativeEnum,
    ...ht(s)
});
class Lc extends vt {
    unwrap()
    {
        return this._def.type
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {ctx: r} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (r.parsedType !== Fe.promise && r.common.async === !1)
            return Ae(r, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.promise,
                received: r.parsedType
            }), it;
        const n = r.parsedType === Fe.promise ? r.data : Promise.resolve(r.data);
        return Er(n.then(a => this._def.type.parseAsync(a, {
            path: r.path,
            errorMap: r.common.contextualErrorMap
        })))
    }
}
Lc.create = (t, s) => new Lc({
    type: t,
    typeName: nt.ZodPromise,
    ...ht(s)
});
class Qn extends vt {
    innerType()
    {
        return this._def.schema
    }
    sourceType()
    {
        return this._def.schema._def.typeName === nt.ZodEffects ? this._def.schema.sourceType() : this._def.schema
    }
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {status: r, ctx: n} = this._processInputParams(s),
            a = this._def.effect || null,
            i = {
                addIssue: o => {
                    Ae(n, o),
                    o.fatal ? r.abort() : r.dirty()
                },
                get path() {
                    return n.path
                }
            };
        if (i.addIssue = i.addIssue.bind(i), a.type === "preprocess") {
            const o = a.transform(n.data, i);
            if (n.common.async)
                return Promise.resolve(o).then(async l => {
                    if (r.value === "aborted")
                        return it;
                    const c = await this._def.schema._parseAsync({
                        data: l,
                        path: n.path,
                        parent: n
                    });
                    return c.status === "aborted" ? it : c.status === "dirty" || r.value === "dirty" ? Bl(c.value) : c
                });
            {
                if (r.value === "aborted")
                    return it;
                const l = this._def.schema._parseSync({
                    data: o,
                    path: n.path,
                    parent: n
                });
                return l.status === "aborted" ? it : l.status === "dirty" || r.value === "dirty" ? Bl(l.value) : l
            }
        }
        if (a.type === "refinement") {
            const o = l => {
                const c = a.refinement(l, i);
                if (n.common.async)
                    return Promise.resolve(c);
                if (c instanceof Promise)
                    throw new Error("Async refinement encountered during synchronous parse operation. Use .parseAsync instead.");
                return l
            };
            if (n.common.async === !1) {
                const l = this._def.schema._parseSync({
                    data: n.data,
                    path: n.path,
                    parent: n
                });
                return l.status === "aborted" ? it : (l.status === "dirty" && r.dirty(), o(l.value), {
                    status: r.value,
                    value: l.value
                })
            } else
                return this._def.schema._parseAsync({
                    data: n.data,
                    path: n.path,
                    parent: n
                }).then(l => l.status === "aborted" ? it : (l.status === "dirty" && r.dirty(), o(l.value).then(() => ({
                    status: r.value,
                    value: l.value
                }))))
        }
        if (a.type === "transform")
            if (n.common.async === !1) {
                const o = this._def.schema._parseSync({
                    data: n.data,
                    path: n.path,
                    parent: n
                });
                if (!ll(o))
                    return o;
                const l = a.transform(o.value, i);
                if (l instanceof Promise)
                    throw new Error("Asynchronous transform encountered during synchronous parse operation. Use .parseAsync instead.");
                return {
                    status: r.value,
                    value: l
                }
            } else
                return this._def.schema._parseAsync({
                    data: n.data,
                    path: n.path,
                    parent: n
                }).then(o => ll(o) ? Promise.resolve(a.transform(o.value, i)).then(l => ({
                    status: r.value,
                    value: l
                })) : o);
        kt.assertNever(a)
    }
}
Qn.create = (t, s, r) => new Qn({
    schema: t,
    typeName: nt.ZodEffects,
    effect: s,
    ...ht(r)
});
Qn.createWithPreprocess = (t, s, r) => new Qn({
    schema: s,
    effect: {
        type: "preprocess",
        transform: t
    },
    typeName: nt.ZodEffects,
    ...ht(r)
});
class Ca extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        return this._getType(s) === Fe.undefined ? Er(void 0) : this._def.innerType._parse(s)
    }
    unwrap()
    {
        return this._def.innerType
    }
}

class Vu extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {ctx: r} = this._processInputParams(s),
            n = {
                ...r,
                common: {
                    ...r.common,
                    issues: []
                }
            },
            a = this._def.innerType._parse({
                data: n.data,
                path: n.path,
                parent: {
                    ...n
                }
            });
        return Tu(a) ? a.then(i => ({
            status: "valid",
            value: i.status === "valid" ? i.value : this._def.catchValue({
                get error() {
                    return new dn(n.common.issues)
                },
                input: n.data
            })
        })) : {
            status: "valid",
            value: a.status === "valid" ? a.value : this._def.catchValue({
                get error() {
                    return new dn(n.common.issues)
                },
                input: n.data
            })
        }
    }
    removeCatch()
    {
        return this._def.innerType
    }
}
Vu.create = (t, s) => new Vu({

    typeName: nt.ZodCatch,

class Ff extends vt {

            const n = this._getOrReturnCtx(s);
            return Ae(n, {
                code: Ne.invalid_type,
                expected: Fe.nan,
                received: n.parsedType
            }), it
        }
        return {
            status: "valid",
            value: s.data
        }
    }
}

class jm extends vt {
    _parse(s)
    {
        const {status: r, ctx: n} = this._processInputParams(s);
        if (n.common.async)
            return (async () => {
                const i = await this._def.in._parseAsync({
                    data: n.data,
                    path: n.path,
                    parent: n
                });
                return i.status === "aborted" ? it : i.status === "dirty" ? (r.dirty(), Bl(i.value)) : this._def.out._parseAsync({
                    data: i.value,
                    path: n.path,
                    parent: n
                })
            })();
        {
            const a = this._def.in._parseSync({
                data: n.data,
                path: n.path,
                parent: n
            });
            return a.status === "aborted" ? it : a.status === "dirty" ? (r.dirty(), {
                status: "dirty",
                value: a.value
            }) : this._def.out._parseSync({
                data: a.value,
                path: n.path,
                parent: n
            })
        }
    }
    static create(s, r)
    {
        return new jm({
            in: s,
            out: r,
            typeName: nt.ZodPipeline
        })
    }
}

    }

function n7({value: t=[], onChange: s, maxImages: r=5, maxSizeBytes: n=5 * 1024 * 1024, acceptedTypes: a=["image/jpeg", "image/jpg", "image/png", "image/webp"], className: i, disabled: o=!1}) {
    const [l, c] = f.useState(!1),
        [d, u] = f.useState(t),
        m = f.useRef(null),
        p = async x => {
            const b = Array.from(x.target.files || []);
            if (b.length !== 0) {
                if (d.length + b.length > r) {
                    alert(`Solo se pueden subir un máximo de ${r} imágenes`);
                    return
                }
                c(!0);
                try {
                    const j = [],
                        h = [];
                    for (const w of b) {
                        if (!a.includes(w.type)) {
                            alert(`Tipo de archivo no válido: ${w.type}. Solo se permiten: ${a.join(", ")}`);
                            continue
                        }
                        if (w.size > n) {
                            alert(`El archivo ${w.name} es demasiado grande. Máximo: ${n / (1024 * 1024)}MB`);
                            continue
                        }
                        const C = URL.createObjectURL(w);
                        h.push(C);
                        const S = new FormData;
                        S.append("image", w);
                        const _ = await fetch("/api/upload-image", {
                            method: "POST",
                            body: S
                        });
                        if (_.ok) {
                            const T = await _.json();
                            j.push(T.imageUrl)
                        } else
                            console.error("Error uploading image:", w.name),
                            URL.revokeObjectURL(C)
                    }
                    const v = [...t, ...j],
                        N = [...d, ...h];
                    s(v),
                    u(N)
                } catch (j) {
                    console.error("Error uploading images:", j)
                } finally {
                    c(!1),
                    m.current && (m.current.value = "")
                }
            }
        },
        y = x => {
            const b = t.filter((v, N) => N !== x),
                j = d.filter((v, N) => N !== x),
                h = d[x];
            h && h.startsWith("blob:") && URL.revokeObjectURL(h),
            s(b),
            u(j)
        },
        g = () => {
            var x;
            (x = m.current) == null || x.click()
        };
    return e.jsxs("div", {
        className: me("space-y-4", i),
        children: [e.jsx($, {
            className: "border-dashed",
            children: e.jsx(V, {
                className: "p-6",
                children: e.jsxs("div", {
                    className: "text-center",

                        className: "mx-auto h-12 w-12 text-muted-foreground/50 mb-4"

}

            className: "max-w-[1400px] mx-auto px-6 py-8",
